title: Implemented Observer Pattern
message:
Implemented Observer Pattern

Final intent is to decouple the model from controller (activity)
completely, and the view should be notified by the model itself whenever
it changes so that view can update itself.
I will also try to implement Protection Proxy over the model so that the
view is only able to read the model not mess with it in any way.

title: Update README.md
message: Update README.md

title: Observe Mode Added
message:
Observe Mode Added

Now pressing the "volume_down" button toggles the mode.
In the Observe mode, all touch events are ignored by the application.
This will be the best place to add drawers and other stuff to change
tools or pan/zoom etc.

title: Canvas Clear funtionality Added
message:
Canvas Clear funtionality Added

Pressing the back button now clears the canvas to background colour
Long Press of the back button exits the application.

title: Code restructuring did not get the results I was expecting
message:
Code restructuring did not get the results I was expecting

-On a side note now the screen remains on when the application is
running.
-Updated logging funcions all over the code and build tested the same.

title: Point Creation now possible
message:
Point Creation now possible

Functionality added : now touching any point and lifting your finger
back marks a point on the canvas.

title: Issue with the previous commit fixed
message:
Issue with the previous commit fixed

In the previous commit many bugs were introduced. The ones known to me
are :
1. The back button on navigation is non responsive
2. The path you are currently drawing was not visible untill you lift
your finger.

This commit fixes the 2nd issue.

title: Implementing MVC
message:
Implementing MVC

While trying to seperate tools, I realized it would be very difficult to
keep the tools seperate and modular from the main activity or view class
if we don't loosen up the couping between the components. So, this is
the first step. This code refactoring is incomplete and has introduced
major amount of bugs back in.

title: Seperating Logging Mechanisms - attempt Two
message:
Seperating Logging Mechanisms - attempt Two

Sorry if this particular commit seems so out of context, but the code
was looking really messy and I was not able to make any further changes
while worrying about it.

title: Trying to seperate tools - attempt ONE
message:
Trying to seperate tools - attempt ONE

Okay, so the intention is to make the tools modular. Currently I am
trying to create a base class named "Tool" which will point to the
objects of concrete classes derived from Tool. Each kind of tool will be
responsible for handling the touchevents by themselves, also to manage
and modify the Paint and Path objects.

For the uber geeks... this is supposed to be something akin to "Bridge"
design pattern.

title: Trying to seperate Logging
message:
Trying to seperate Logging

This is just a first attempt to seperate logging constants and functions
from the code. I think this will require a lot of studying on my part to
be able to first understand the concept of logging in Android with it's
different priority levels and sepearting it into a library.

title: Finallizing support for API11 and above, a.k.a Android 3.0+
message:
Finallizing support for API11 and above, a.k.a Android 3.0+

To be able to set immersive mode and other related fullscreen features,
it gets too tiresome below API 11. I am doing this because in the
CanvasActivity class, function named setImmersiveMode() the second line
calls upon the function "getSystemVisibility()" which belongs to API11
and I am unable to find a suitable alternative to it in API10 and below.
